To be able to launch Anti-Theft on the device remotely, set the app as a Device Administrator
For protection from online threats, enable Web Protection
Device is disconnected from Web Management >
The Anti-Theft features are disabled, secret code recovery is unavailable: the device is disconnected from My Kaspersky
To launch Anti-Theft features remotely and to recover secret code, connect to My Kaspersky.
Enable protection to scan your device in real time
New apps are scanned automatically in the premium version.
"I'm using Kaspersky Internet Security for Android. Like it."
Kaspersky Internet Security for Android really works

Go to Premium
Scan new apps automatically, secure browser and more
Privacy Protection lets you temporarily hide your private contacts, call history, and text messages using the app settings or remotely by sending a special SMS command from any device.
Anti-Theft can remotely turn on an alarm on the device, lock and locate it, wipe information from it or take a mugshot of the person currently using your device via Web Management or SMS commands.
Your Kaspersky Account is not activated. To finish initial Anti-Theft configuration, please check your mailbox and activate your Kaspersky Account.
No supported browser is installed on the device. Web Protection is disabled.
Select the activation code to use premium version
Please wait. Activating a trial version...
No data to hide. Add contacts whose information you want to hide
Please wait while contacts are updated...
Group of contacts blocked by Call & Text Filter
Contacts from this list are always blocked.
Contacts from this list are always allowed.
Protection in real time from viruses and other malicious apps is enabled
In recommended mode, Protection settings are set automatically and cannot be changed. To change them, select the extended protection mode.
Please wait while protection is enabled...
Please wait while protection is disabled...
The scan of the app %s is complete. No threats detected.
"Please wait. Contact information is being hidden..."
"Please wait. Contact information is being displayed..."
Hiding information in %d minutes after device switches to Power Saving mode
"Data can be hidden remotely by the 'hide: [code]' SMS command"

"Add the contacts for which you want to hide information.
After that, you can hide information for them by using a switch in the app main window."
Check the current date and time on the device and start the update again.
Anti-Virus databases and app version are up-to-date.
Unable to update the Anti-Virus databases.
You are using the free version.
License information is out-of-date. To update license information, please check the Internet connection.
You have a license on My Kaspersky
Select a license on My Kaspersky to activate the premium version
The app will be activated without additional charges.
Enter the old activation code to get a discount
You receive this activation code when you purchase a license.
You received this activation code when you purchased a previous license.
Please wait. Connecting to the server...
Incorrect activation code. Please check the characters you entered.
The maximum number of allowed characters is entered.

"To activate the app, it is necessary to connect to the Internet.
Select \"Settings\" to go to the Internet connection settings."

"An Internet connection is required to update the databases.
Select \"Settings\" to go to the Internet connection settings."
This device is locked! Please return it to its owner.
Kaspersky Internet Security: Unable to lock the device. The Lock feature is disabled on the device.
Kaspersky Internet Security: alarm turned on.
Kaspersky Internet Security: unable to turn alarm on. The Alarm feature is disabled on the device.
Lock when SIM card is replaced
Kaspersky Internet Security: the current GPS coordinates of the device: latitudeâ€”%1$.6f, longitudeâ€”%2$.6f
Kaspersky Internet Security: Device not located.
Kaspersky Internet Security: Unable to locate the device. The Locate feature is disabled on the device.
To use Locate, enable the GPS module or connect to the Internet.
Are you sure you want to delete all entries from the list of contacts to hide?
Cannot add this contact. The same contact is added to the list of blocked contacts for Call & Text Filter.
Entered activation code has already been used.
Set the correct date and time and retry the activation.
Unable to activate app. The activation code that you entered does not work for Kaspersky Internet Security.
The codes entered are different. Please specify the code again.
The secret code has been saved.
Unable to save the secret code.
Enter the secret code for Kaspersky Internet Security:
The code is too short. The secret code must contain 4 to 16 numerals.
The secret code is too long. The secret code must contain 4 to 16 numerals.
The secret code is weak. Save it?

"For a strong code, we recommend that it contain at least 7 numerals.
Save the current code?"
Kaspersky Internet Security: Unable to wipe data. The Data Wipe feature is disabled on the device.
Kaspersky Internet Security: SIM card replaced on your device.
To change the Privacy Protection settings, disable data hiding.
Information for selected contacts is now displayed. To hide it, use the switch in the main window of the app.
Invalid email. It contains characters that are not permitted. Please enter a valid email.
Pop-up notifications on the status bar about app functioning

Allow incoming calls and text messages from all contacts in the device phonebook
Block incoming calls and text messages from all numbers containing letters
Are you sure you want to delete this entry from the list?
Are you sure you want to delete all entries from the list?
Add contacts from whom you do not want to receive calls or text messages. To block calls and text messages from these contacts, select \"Blocked contacts\" or \"Standard\" mode.
Add contacts from whom you want to receive calls and text messages. To receive calls and text messages from these contacts, select \"Allowed contacts\" or \"Standard\" mode.
To stay protected, renew the license.
An entry with these criteria already exists.
Block unwanted incoming calls and text messages by creating lists of allowed and blocked contacts
The phone number receiving the SMS command:
Secret code of the app on the device that receives the SMS command:

Enter the secret code of the app on the device to which you want to send the SMS command.
Please wait while Kaspersky Internet Security starts...
Kaspersky Internet Security: private information is hidden.
Kaspersky Internet Security: unable to hide private information.
Kaspersky Internet Security is running in Reduced Functionality mode. The feature is not available.
Kaspersky Internet Security: Unable to wipe private data. The Data Wipe feature is disabled on the device.
Kaspersky Internet Security: private data is wiped from the device.
It is recommended that you restart the device to apply the changes.
A scheduled scan of the entire file system is in progress...
A scheduled Anti-Virus database update is in progress...
Please configure the required SIM Watch settings
To enable SIM Watch, specify a phone number or email to receive a new number or enable device lock settings.
"Protection is disabled. The license has expired."
Block incoming calls and text messages
Allow incoming calls and text messages
A trial version has been previously activated on this device. It cannot be activated again.
Cannot activate the app. Limit of available activations is reached for the entered activation code.
Invalid activation code. Subscription expired. Please contact your provider.
Unable to connect to the server. Please check your Internet connection and start the update again.
Kaspersky Internet Security cannot run if installed on the storage card. Please reinstall the app in the device storage.
A new version of Kaspersky Internet Security is available. Do you want to upgrade?

"Current version: %1$s New version: %2$s
Warning! Please start the app after the version update (for example, tap the app icon in the notification area)."
Downloading the new version of Kaspersky Internet Security
Canceling download of the new version of Kaspersky Internet Security...
Cannot upgrade the app. Check the free space on the storage card and try to upgrade Kaspersky Internet Security again.
"The app will stop notifying you about an available new version %s . You can upgrade later by starting the upgrade manually."
Select a call from the contact you want to add to the list of blocked contacts.
Select a call from the contact you want to add to the list of allowed contacts
Select a text message from the contact you want to add to the list of blocked contacts
Select a text message from the contact you want to add to the list of allowed contacts
To remove the %1$s app, go to the main app window and select Advanced Settings > Uninstall app > %2$s.
The app will no longer be activated as Device Administrator. Self-Defense will be disabled.
The app needs these permissions to enable Self-Defense and to automatically lock the device if it is lost or stolen, wipe personal data, and take a mugshot of the person currently using the device.

"The app is no longer set as a Device Administrator.
Warning! Self-Defence is disabled. You will not be able to launch the Anti-Theft feature on the device remotely.
To unlock, enter the secret code for the app."
Configuration of your private data protection
To be able to send a remote command to the device and protect your data, as well as enable Self-Defense of the app, set the app as a Device Administrator in the next window.
Enter the recovery code to unlock the device:
Incorrect recovery code. Please enter the recovery code specified for your device on the website.
System lock of the device (for example, using a PIN or Pattern locking mechanism) is also disabled. If you previously had system lock enabled, please re-enable it through the device settings.
"Files scan complete. Path: %1$s Objects scanned: %2$s Threats detected: %3$d Quarantined: %5$d Neutralized: %6$d"
"Infected file cannot be placed in Quarantine Infected file: %s."
Unable to update Anti-Virus databases. Error: %2$d
Anti-Virus databases are up-to-date. Update is not required.

"For Web Protection to scan websites as you visit them, set the standard Android browser as your default browser. Current default browser: %s. Tap \"Next\" > \"Default settings\". Then tap the \"Back\" button to return to the previous screen."

"Tap \"Next\". In the next window, select the \"Use by default for this action\" check box and select the standard Android browser - %s. Then tap the \"Back\" button to return to the previous screen."
If you like Kaspersky Internet Security, please rate it on Google Play.
Text message %1$s with the %2$s link is blocked. Reason: %3$s
Are you sure you want to delete all reports?
Additional scan of new apps through the Kaspersky Security Network cloud service enabled
Additional scan of new apps through the Kaspersky Security Network cloud service disabled
Send SMS commands to manage another device
Receiving SMS commands when SIM-card is changed
Specify a temporary PIN for the device

"To enable the app to lock the device when it is stolen or lost, you must set a temporary PIN for the device. To do so, specify a temporary PIN in the next window and tap \"Back\".
You will be able to reset this PIN in the future."

"Thank you. You can now lock the device remotely if it is lost or stolen.
You can now reset this PIN by tapping \"Reset and continue\". If you choose not to reset it, you must remember it. You will be prompted to enter it every time you turn on the device."
To return to app settings, tap the \"Back\" button to return to the previous screen.
You can remotely control the Anti-Theft feature on your device using Web Management. You need a Kaspersky Account for this.
Detection of adware and apps that can be used by cyber criminals to damage a device or user data
Sign in with Kaspersky Account to manage Anti-Theft
Create a Kaspersky Account to manage Anti-Theft
Use a password at least eight characters long, combining uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals (example: Qwerty123).
Password: short. Use a password at least eight characters long, combining uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals (example: Qwerty123).
Password: weak. Use a password at least eight characters long, combining uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals (example: Qwerty123).
Enter the characters in the image:
Characters entered do not match those in the image. Please try again.
Unable to update Anti-Virus databases of the app. Network connection protocol has changed. Please check your Internet connection settings.
Email not entered or entered incorrectly. Please try again.
Server error. Please try again later.
Clear the app settings or reinstall the app.
Incorrect password. Please re-enter the password. If you have forgotten the password, you can restore it.
Web Management is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.
A Kaspersky Account already exists for this email. You can <u>sign in</u> using this email.
A Kaspersky Account does not exist for this email. You can <u>sign up</u> using this email.
An active Internet connection is required
An Internet connection is required to fully configure the app. Please check your Internet connection settings and retry.

"App setup is still in progress.
Are you sure you want to stop setup?"

"You need the secret code to access the Anti-Theft and Privacy Protection settings. The secret code must contain 4 to 16 numerals.
Write down the secret code and store it in a safe place."
Activation code is needed to use the premium features of %s. <u>Learn more about premium features</u>.
Enter the activation code received when the app was purchased.
Purchase a new license through the online store.
Activate a trial version of the app.
Activate the Anti-Theft and Self-Defense features

The app must be set as the only Device Administrator in order to start Anti-Theft remotely if the device is lost or stolen and to prevent unauthorized removal of the app. To do this, tap \"Next\", and in the next window clear the check boxes for the names of all apps except Kaspersky Internet Security.

The app must be set as the only Device Administrator in order to start Anti-Theft remotely if the device is lost or stolen and to prevent unauthorized removal of the app. To do this, set the app as a Device Administrator in the next window.
Apps incompatible with Kaspersky Internet Security detected

"To work properly, the app must be set as the only Device Administrator. This requires revoking the Device Administrator rights of other apps by tapping \"Disable\".
The following apps are currently set as Device Administrators:"
License has expired. To continue using the app, renew the license.

"Anti-Virus performs the following functions: Protection, Scan, Update, and Quarantine. You can configure each function separately.
For optimal data security, Kaspersky Lab recommends selecting the extended or recommended protection mode and enabling Cloud Security Scan in addition, as well as regularly updating the Anti-Virus databases to provide real-time protection against threats and to keep the protection of your device up-to-date."
While scanning the device or when protection is active, the application moves found infected files to Quarantine (a special isolated storage). Quarantined detected files cannot harm the device.
Using <u>Web Management</u> you can remotely turn on an alarm on the device, lock and locate it, delete data from it, or take a mugshot of the person currently using your device.
Expected time for synchronization with Web Management to receive commands:
You are using the trial version of the app. The waiting time for synchronization is extended.
An established Internet connection is necessary for synchronization.
The device is linked to a Kaspersky Account

"Dear User, please check your email %s and confirm your Kaspersky Account registration.
If you have not received a confirmation, the message may have been marked as spam."
Enable Anti-Theft functions on the device in order to launch them using Web Management or SMS commands.

Web Protection scans websites before they are opened and blocks websites that are considered malicious or spoofed versions of known companies, such as those of banks, online payment systems, or online auctions.
Web Protection checks websites in the standard Android browser only and is incompatible with other browsers.
Browser needed for working with Web Protection: %1$s

For Web Protection to work properly, we recommend setting the standard Android browser as your default browser. If you do not want to change your default browser, start the standard Android browser every time you need to browse the web safely.
Supported browser not found on device.
Checking of websites before they are opened is disabled.
Checking of links in incoming text messages is enabled
<font color=#ff8080>Checking of links in incoming text messages is disabled<font>
Unable to restore data from Quarantine
Unable to delete data from Quarantine
Unable to delete all data from Quarantine
DeleteÂ %1$sÂ from Quarantine? The file will be deleted permanently.
Delete all files from Quarantine? Files will be permanently deleted.

The Protection feature in real time monitors file activity in the background and checks newly installed apps prior to their first launch by using Anti-Virus databases and the Kaspersky Security Network cloud service.
View information about your current license, configure notifications, change the app secret code, and view information about the app or delete the app.
To enable Kaspersky Internet Security to lock the device and delete data from it remotely, activate the app as a Device Administrator.

You can send SMS commands from a device with Kaspersky Internet Security installed or from any other device by creating a standard SMS message with special text:

Â â€¢ alarm: [code] â€” to lock the device and turn on an alarm;
Â â€¢ find: [code] â€” to lock and locate the device;
Â â€¢ wipe: [code] â€” to wipe private data and storage card data;
Â â€¢ fullreset: [code] â€” to wipe all data and reset device to factory settings;
Â â€¢ hide: [code] â€” to hide private contact information.
[Code] is the secret code for Kaspersky Internet Security on the device to which you send the command.

Warning! SMS commands are billed in accordance with the mobile rate plan of the device from which the command is sent.
extended. Monitors actions in relation to files and checks installed apps
To secure the data on your device against viruses and other malware, it is recommended that you set the Protection mode to extended or recommended.
Additional scan of new apps through the Kaspersky Security Network cloud service enabled
Additional scan of new apps through the Kaspersky cloud service disabled
"Scan of your device's entire file system, the contents of the internal storage card only, or a selected folder."

Please update the subscription status in the app settings or contact your service provider.
To resume protection, visit the provider website, get a new activation code, and enter it in the app settings.
To resume protection, make sure you have sufficient funds in your account with the provider and then update the subscription status in the app settings.
To continue using the app, resume your subscription in your personal account on the provider website, and then update the subscription status in the app settings.

Subscription has been canceled by the provider. Protection is disabled. To resume protection, deposit sufficient funds with your provider.

"Subscription has been paused at your request. Protection is disabled. To continue using the app, renew your subscription in your personal account on the provider's website and then update the subscription status in the app settings."

Scanner protects your data from viruses and other malware, while also updating the Anti-Virus databases, which are needed to protect your data from new threats.

"Scanner performs the following functions: Scan, Update, and Quarantine.
For optimal data security, scan your device regularly and update the Anti-Virus databases regularly to keep your device protection up-to-date."

"License is not expired. After purchasing a license, the app will be activated under a new license. You can activate the app on the another device under the previous license until it expires. If for any reasons you do not want to activate the app on the another device under the previous license, Kaspersky Lab recommends purchasing a new license after expiration of the previous license."
To do this, save this code. After activation the app on this device under the new license, apply this code on another device.

"Registered trademarks and service marks are the exclusive property of their respective owners. Android and Google are trademarks of Google, Inc."

"Kaspersky Internet Security provides protection against viruses and other malware, scans all files on the device, and neutralizes detected threats. Kaspersky Internet Security helps prevent your private data from being stolen online, such as theft of your online banking or payment system passwords. If your device is lost or stolen, Kaspersky Internet Security will help you locate your device and keep your data secure. Contact Kaspersky Lab with any questions (http://www.kaspersky.com, http://support.kaspersky.com/helpdesk.html).
The digital signature is verified by Crypto-C-2.0, (C) CryptoEx LLX http://www.cryptoex.ru."
The recovery code safely recovers the secret code of the app. You can obtain the recovery code by signing in to Web Management with your Kaspersky Account.
